A V belt drive section from a 5 KW torque motor, which runs at 1440 rpm to a light duty compressor running at 970 rpm. The compressor runs for 24 hours per day. Space is available for a centre distance of about 500 mm. Assume the pitch diameter of the driving pulley is 150 mm. Find suitable section type.

It is required to design a two-stage spur gear reduction unit with 20° full-depth involute teeth. The input shaft rotates at 1440 rpm and receives 10 kW power through a flexible coupling. The speed of an output shaft should be approximately 180 rpm. Draw a suitable layout and find the speed reduction at each stage and the number of teeth in each gear.

A multi-disk clutch consists of two steel disks with one bronze disk. The inner and the outer diameters of the contacting surfaces are 200 mm and 250 mm respectively. The coefficient of friction is 0.1 and the maximum pressure between the contacting surfaces is limited to 0.4 N/mm². Assuming uniform wear theory, calculate the required operating force to engage the clutch and the power transmitting capacity at 720 rpm.

It is required to design a pair of spur gears with 20° full-depth involute teeth based on the Lewis equation. The velocity factor is to be used to account for the dynamic load. The pinion shaft is connected to a 10 kW, 1440 rpm motor. The speed reduction is 4:1. The pinion starting torque is 150% of the rated torque. The gear is made of plain carbon steel 40C8 (with ultimate tensile strength 600 N/mm²). The factor of safety is 1.5. Design the gears, specify their dimensions, and suggest suitable surface hardness for the gears.

A four-cylinder vertical engine has cranks 150 mm long. The planes of rotation of the first, second, and fourth cranks are 400 mm, 200 mm, and 200 mm respectively from the third crank, and their reciprocating masses are 50 kg, 60 kg, and 50 kg respectively. The arm rotates at 300 rpm anticlockwise about the center of gear A, which is fixed. Determine the speed of gear B. If gear A, instead of being fixed, rotates at 600 rpm clockwise, what will be the speed of gear B?

A tube measuring 2 m in length and with an outer diameter of 25 mm is intended for the condensation of saturated steam at 100°C, while maintaining the tube surface at 92°C. Determine the average heat transfer coefficient and the steam condensation rate if the tube is horizontally oriented and steam condenses on its exterior surface.

A Carbon Steel pipe with a thermal conductivity of 45 W/m·K, featuring an inner diameter of 78 mm and a 5.5 mm thickness, incorporates eight longitudinal fins, each 1.5 mm thick and extending 30 mm from the pipe wall. Given wall, ambient, and surface heat transfer temperatures of 150°C, 28°C, and 75 W/m²·K respectively, compute the percentage increase in heat transfer rate for the finned tube compared to the plain tube.

The inner side of a furnace wall maintains a temperature of 640°C, while the opposite side is at 240°C. To mitigate heat loss from the furnace, calculate the percentage decrease in heat loss resulting from doubling the wall thickness.
Enumerate the various types of evaporators utilized in the process industry. Contrast single-effect evaporators with multi-effect evaporators, including their differences in feed arrangements.
Clarify free and forced convection using dimensionless numbers and delineate their significance in process industry.

The velocity of water flowing through a tube of 22 mm diameter is 2 m/s. The steam condenses at 150°C on the outside surface of the tube, heating the water from 15°C to 150°C over the entire length of the tube. Neglect the tube and steam side film resistances. Calculate the heat transfer coefficient and the length of the tube.

It is desired to use a double pipe counterflow heat exchanger to cool 3 kg/s of oil (Cp = 2.1 kJ/kg·K) from 120°C. Cooling water at 20°C enters the heat exchanger at a rate of 6 kg/s. The overall heat transfer coefficient of the heat exchanger is 600 W/m²·K and the heat transfer area is 6 m². Calculate the exit temperatures of oil and water.

The state of stress occurs in a machine component of brass having yield strength 160 MPa. Using maximum distortion energy criteria, determine whether yielding occurs when (a) σ1 = +45 MPa and (b) σ2 = +45 MPa.

Derive the expression for a closed coil helical spring for its deflection under axial load. A close-coiled helical spring subjected to an axial load of 200 N has 12 coils of wire diameter 16 mm and mean coil diameter 25 cm. Find (a) deflection and (b) maximum shear stress using Wahl’s factor.
What do you mean by Specific Weight and Specific Gravity?

In terms of MLT, determine the dimensions of angular momentum, work, and power.
What do you mean by Laminar Sub-layer?
What are minor head losses in pipe flow?
Air of 15 kg/m³ at 300 K and absolute pressure of 2.3 bar is flowing through a pipe. Determine the minimum diameter of the pipe if the flow velocity is limited to 7 m/s.
What is Archimedes' principle? What are the conditions of stability of immersed and floating bodies? Explain with the help of a suitable diagram.
Show that the first law of thermodynamics (steady flow energy equation) for a steady, incompressible, frictionless flow is the same as Bernoulli's equation for such a flow.
What do you mean by Similitude and types of similarities?
What do you understand by the boundary layer? Explain with reference to flow over a flat plate.

A 6 cm diameter pipe takes off abruptly from a large tank and runs 10 m, then expands abruptly to 11 cm diameter and runs 50 m, and next discharges directly into the open air with a velocity of 1.6 m/s. Calculate the necessary height of the water surface above the point of discharge. Take friction coefficient f = 0.0065 in Darcy equation.

A wooden block floats in water with 7 cm height projecting above the water surface. The block is next floated in glycerine (relative density = 1.37) and projects 7.2 cm above the surface of glycerine. Calculate the height of the block and its relative density.

Water is flowing through an inclined pipeline having a diameter of 25 cm at the lower end and 50 cm at the upper end, which is 5 meters above the lower end of the pipe. If the pressure at the lower and upper ends of the pipe are 1.2 bar and 0.5 bar respectively and Q is 0.3 m³/s, determine the loss of head and the direction of flow.
Write a short note on the following: (a) Rotational flow and Vorticity, (b) Impulse-Momentum relationship.

Give the classification of OR models.

What is dummy activity?

Find the optimum solution to the given transportation problem where cells contain unit transportation costs.
Simulate the demand for the next 10 days for a bakery using given random numbers and probabilities.
What do you understand by Queueing Models?
Explain Integer Programming with a suitable example.
Explain how the theory of replacement is used for replacing items whose maintenance cost increases with time.

A particular item has a demand of 2000 units per year. The cost of one order is Rs. 100, and the holding cost per unit is Rs. 2.40/year. Determine the economic lot size and the number of orders per year.
Draw the network, determine early and late start schedules, find the critical path, and minimum project completion time for the given activity data.
Using von Mises criteria, determine the factor of safety for a plane stress state with σx=100 MPa, σy=100 MPa, and τxy=100 MPa. Assume σyt=350 MPa and σyc=350 MPa.
Derive the expression for hoop stress induced in a thin rotating disc.
A CI pipe of 600 mm diameter is used to carry water under a head of 50 m. Determine the thickness of the pipe if permissible stress is 25 MPa.
Compute the volumetric strain in a cylindrical shell in terms of longitudinal and hoop strain.
Explain the meaning of modulus of toughness.
What is the advantage of a compound cylinder?
For a given stress-strain diagram, explain how you will calculate strain energy density and modulus of resilience.
Explain with an example the meaning of shear center.
State the assumptions involved in the derivation of shear stresses in a beam.
A closed-coil helical spring with 24 turns is made of 8 mm diameter wire. The mean diameter of the spring is 80 mm, and it carries a load of 250 N. Determine the deflection of the spring.

A bolt is subjected to an axial pull of 16 kN and a transverse shear force of 10 kN. Determine the safety using maximum shear stress and distortion energy theories. Elastic limit = 250 MPa, factor of safety = 2.5, Poisson’s ratio = 0.3.

A simply supported beam of span 4 m with a central point load of 10 kN has a T-section (160 mm wide, 300 mm deep). Determine bending and shear stresses at the top, 100 mm, and 40 mm from the neutral axis, and at the neutral axis.
Derive the bending equation and explain its assumptions.
Explain the theory of torsion and derive the torsion equation for a circular shaft.
Determine the shear force and bending moment diagrams for a simply supported beam of 6 m length carrying a uniformly distributed load of 35 kN/m.

At a certain point in a strained material, stresses on two planes are at right angles to each other: 40 N/mm² and 20 N/mm² (both tensile), accompanied by a shear stress of 10 N/mm². Find graphically or otherwise the position of principal planes and evaluate the principal stresses.

A flitched beam consists of a wooden joist 20 cm wide and 10 cm deep strengthened by steel plates (12 mm thick and 30 cm deep) on either side of the joist. If the maximum stress in the wooden joist is 100 kg/cm², find the corresponding maximum stress in steel and the moment of resistance of the section. Take Es = 20 Ew.

A cylindrical shell of 600 mm diameter and 3 m length is subjected to internal pressure of 1.5 MPa. Calculate the hoop and longitudinal stresses, and determine the volumetric strain. Assume E = 200 GPa and Poisson’s ratio = 0.3.
What do you mean by nozzle efficiency in steam nozzles?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of multistage compression in compressors?
What is 'Free Air Delivery' in compressors?
What do you mean by slip in compressors?

What is 'Degree of Reaction' in steam turbines?
Explain the thermodynamic analysis of a turbojet on a T-S diagram.

What do you mean by regeneration in gas turbine cycles?
What are the classifications of condensers?

Steam enters the nozzles of a de Laval turbine at 1050 m/s at an angle of 20°. The blade velocity is 350 m/s, blades are symmetrical, and the mass flow rate is 0.6 kg/s. Allowing a friction factor of 0.85, determine: i) Blade efficiency ii) Power developed.
Explain the working of a two-stage reciprocating compressor with the help of p-V and T-S diagrams.
Draw velocity triangles for an axial compressor and represent the different stages of pressure rise on T-S coordinates.
What do you mean by critical pressure ratio in steam nozzles? How does it depend on the quality of steam?
What are the methods to evaluate vacuum efficiency and condenser efficiency of condensers?

A compound cylinder is formed by shrinking one tube into another, with the internal diameter of the inner tube being 120 mm and the external diameter of the outer tube being 180 mm. After shrinking, the radial pressure at the common surface is 40 MPa. With an internal pressure of 90 MPa, determine the final stresses at various surfaces of the cylinder and the resultant radial pressure at the common surface.

The span of a simply supported and centrally loaded laminated steel spring is 600 mm. The central deflection does not exceed 36 mm for a proof load of 6 kN, and the bending stress does not exceed 400 MPa. Find suitable values for the width, thickness, and number of plates. Also, determine the radius to which the plates should be formed. Assume width is 8 times the thickness and E=205 GPa.

The rotor disc of a turbine is 800 mm in diameter at the blade ring and is fixed to a shaft of 60 mm diameter. If the minimum thickness of the disc is 8 mm, find the thickness of the shaft for uniform stress of 210 MPa at 7500 rpm. The density of the disc material is 7800 kg/m³.

A curved bar of rectangular section (40 mm width and 40 mm depth, mean radius of curvature 100 mm) is initially unstressed. If a bending moment of 400 N·m is applied, determine the stresses at the inner and outer surfaces. Sketch the variation of stress across the section.
State one application of strain energy in the analysis of mechanics of solids.
Which failure theory is used for ductile materials?
What should be the ratio of diameter over thickness ratio for using thin and thick cylinder theory respectively?
Draw the shear stress distribution for a beam of rectangular cross-section.
What is Wahl’s correction factor?
Sketch a channel C-section and show shear stress distribution across the section.
List the assumptions made for deriving Lame’s equation.
Enlist two methods through which you can increase the strength of a cylinder subjected to internal pressure.
Express the stress in the rotating rim in terms of its density and velocity.
Express the formula of a curved beam in terms of curvature radius change.

For a close coiled helical spring subjected to an axial load of 200 N, having 12 coils of wire diameter 16 mm and mean coil diameter 25 cm, find (a) axial deflection and (b) maximum shear stress using Wahl’s factor.

A boiler with 3 m internal diameter is subjected to a steam pressure of 7.2 bar. Find the principal stresses in the boiler plate if it is 12 mm thick. What is the maximum shear stress in the boiler shell?

A steel bar circular in section (4 cm diameter and 4 m long) is subjected to an axial pull of 100 KN. Find the strain energy. What will be the strain energy under the above pull if the diameter of the bar is 2.6 cm over one-half of its length and 4 cm over the other half?

A shaft of 10 cm diameter is subjected to a maximum torque of 15 kN·m and a bending moment of 10 kN·m at a particular section. Find the factor of safety according to the maximum shear stress theory if the elastic limit in simple tension is 240 MN/m².
